thread.title: High School Football Roundup: Tech downs Polytech 56-7, Golden Knight fall to Smyrna
thread.title_full: High School Football Roundup: Tech downs Polytech 56-7, Golden Knight fall to Smyrna

author: Mike Santa Barbara
title: High School Football Roundup: Tech downs Polytech 56-7, Golden Knight fall to Smyrna
text: High School Football Roundup: Tech downs Polytech 56-7, Golden Knight fall to Smyrna Comment By Mike Santa Barbara Posted Oct. 23, 2015 @ 11:13 pm Sussex Tech 56, Polytech 7 After suffering their first loss of the 2015 season, the Sussex Tech Ravens bounced back in a big way Friday night, defeating Polytech 56-7. The Ravens took control from the jump Friday night, building a 42-0 halftime lead over the Panthers. Pat Griffin Led the way for the Ravens, rushing for 157 yards on the ground and scoring twice in the double-digit victory. Ja’ron Hunt-Fletcher also made his presence felt for Tech, rushing for two touchdowns and 97 yards. The Ravens are now 6-1 on the season, and are back in action next week when they host Dover Friday night at 7:30 p.m. Sussex Central 21, Smyrna 58 Smyrna improved to 6-1 on the season Friday night, defeating Sussex Central 58-21 in front of a home crowd. Will Knight once again led the way for the Eagles, finding the end-zone four times in the victory. Smyrna led 22-0 after one quarter thanks to a Nolan Henderson touchdown pass to Donte Ritchie, and rushing scores from Henderson and Knight. Knight had the only Smyrna score in a second quarter that saw the Golden Knight get back into the game with three scores, two touchdowns from KiAnte’ Sturgis, and one from John Morris cutting the Eagles lead to 34-21 at half time. Smyrna’s defense would shutout the Golden Knights in the second half while the offense continue to go to work scoring 24 more points in the half to win going away. Knight added two more rushing touchdowns in the second half, along with scores from Stephen Whaley and another touchdown pass from Henderson to Brandon Bishop. The Golden Knights are back in action next Friday night when they host the win-less Polytech Panthers at 7:30 p.m.
